kwargs.content: You are an experienced xml developer, who specializes in migrating code from  to eap and eap8 and jakarta-ee and jakarta-ee9+ and jws and jws6+

I will give you a  file for which I want to take one step towards migrating to eap and eap8 and jakarta-ee and jakarta-ee9+ and jws and jws6+.

I will provide you with static source code analysis information highlighting an issue which needs to be addressed.

Fix only the problem described. Other problems will be solved in subsequent steps so it is unnecessary to handle them now.

Before attempting to migrate the code to eap and eap8 and jakarta-ee and jakarta-ee9+ and jws and jws6+ reason through what changes are required and why.

Pay attention to changes you make and impacts to external dependencies in the pom.xml as well as changes to imports we need to consider.

Remember when updating or adding annotations that the class must be imported.

As you make changes that impact the pom.xml or imports, be sure you explain what needs to be updated.

After you have shared your step by step thinking, provide a full output of the updated file.

# Input information

## Input File

File name: "beans.xml"
Source file contents:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!--
    JBoss, Home of Professional Open Source
    Copyright 2015, Red Hat, Inc. and/or its affiliates, and individual

    See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    limitations under the License.
-->
<!-- Marker file indicating CDI should be enabled -->
<beans xmlns="http://xmlns.jcp.org/xml/ns/javaee" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
	   xsi:schemaLocation="
      http://xmlns.jcp.org/xml/ns/javaee
      http://xmlns.jcp.org/xml/ns/javaee/beans_1_1.xsd"
	   bean-discovery-mode="all">
</beans>
```

## Issues


### incident 0
incident to fix: "Replace `http://xmlns.jcp.org/xml/ns/javaee` with `https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee` and change the schema version number"
Line number: 18



# Output Instructions
Structure your output in Markdown format such as:

## Reasoning
Write the step by step reasoning in this markdown section. If you are unsure of a step or reasoning, clearly state you are unsure and why.

## Updated xml File
```xml
// Write the updated file in this section. If the file should be removed, make the content of the updated file a comment explaining it should be removed.
```

## Additional Information (optional)

If you have any additional details or steps that need to be performed, put it here.

## Reasoning
To address the issue described in incident 0, we need to update the XML namespace and schema version number in the `beans.xml` file. The current namespace `http://xmlns.jcp.org/xml/ns/javaee` is specific to Java EE, but since we are migrating to Jakarta EE, we need to replace it with the Jakarta EE namespace `https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee`.

Additionally, we need to update the schema version number to match the Jakarta EE version. Since the exact version is not specified, we will assume the latest version. However, please note that the correct version should be verified based on the actual Jakarta EE version being used.

The updated namespace and schema version number will ensure that the `beans.xml` file is compatible with Jakarta EE.

## Updated xml File
```xml

    JBoss, Home of Professional Open Source

-->
<!-- Marker file indicating CDI should be enabled -->
<beans xmlns="https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
	   xsi:schemaLocation="
      https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee
      https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee/beans_4_0.xsd"
	   bean-discovery-mode="all">
</beans>
```

## Additional Information
No additional changes are required in the `pom.xml` file or imports for this specific update. However, please note that further updates may be required to complete the migration to Jakarta EE.

## Reasoning
To address the issue described in incident 0, we need to update the XML namespace for Java EE to the new Jakarta EE namespace. This change is required because the project is being migrated to Jakarta EE, which has a different namespace than Java EE.

The original namespace `http://xmlns.jcp.org/xml/ns/javaee` needs to be replaced with `https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee`. Additionally, the schema version number needs to be updated to reflect the new Jakarta EE version.

Since the project is being migrated to Jakarta EE 9+, we will use the `jakartaee` namespace with the `9.0` schema version.

No changes are required in the `pom.xml` file for this specific update, but it's essential to ensure that the project dependencies are updated to use the Jakarta EE 9+ versions.

## Updated xml File
```xml

    distribution for a full listing of individual contributors.

    WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
    See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
    limitations under the License.
-->
<!-- Marker file indicating CDI should be enabled -->
<beans xmlns="https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
	   xsi:schemaLocation="
      https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee
      https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee/beans_9_0.xsd"
	   bean-discovery-mode="all">
</beans>
```

## Additional Information (optional)
When updating the project dependencies to use Jakarta EE 9+, ensure that the `pom.xml` file includes the necessary dependencies, such as `jakarta.platform:jakarta.jakartaee-api:9.0.0` or later. Additionally, verify that the project's Java version is compatible with Jakarta EE 9+.

meta.message: Replace `http://xmlns.jcp.org/xml/ns/javaee` with `https://jakarta.ee/xml/ns/jakartaee` and change the schema version number
